Large daily temperature fluctuations, often exceeding 20°C between day and night.
Low precipitation, typically less than 250mm annually, with high evaporation rates.
Mounds of windblown sand that can move and shift over time.
Exposed rock formations that provide shade and shelter.
Isolated water source surrounded by desert, often fed by underground springs.
Temporary waterways that flow only after rainfall events.
Coarse-grained soil with poor water retention but good drainage.
Dense layer of pebbles and rocks at the surface, formed by wind removing fine particles.
Dark coating on exposed rock surfaces, composed of clay minerals with iron and manganese oxides.
Flat, dry lake bed that occasionally floods after heavy rain.
Sudden, intense flooding events often occurring in desert washes after heavy rainfall.
Dry streambed that carries water only after rainfall, often with distinct vegetation.
Area of wind-deposited sand formations with specialized plant and animal communities.
Elevated area with exposed bedrock and boulders, providing shade and shelter.
Deep, narrow channel with steep walls, often with increased moisture and biodiversity.
Specialized mutualistic relationship between yucca plants and yucca moths.
Protection of seedlings by established desert plants providing shade and improved soil.
Movement of plant seeds by desert animals, aiding plant reproduction and distribution.
